title: What are some major events that occurred in the 1400 and 1500’s? - Quora

response.answer_text: Here are a few events that may qualify as major events: 1407…King Henry IV grants a charter to the Company of Merchant Adventurers of London 1422-1491…life of Wiliam Caxton, the first person to introduce a printing press into England 1455-1487…the Wars of the Roses 1394-1460…life of Prince Henry the Navigator (Portuguese) 1400-1800…the Age of Discovery 1492…Ferdinand and Isabelle capture Granada, the Moriscos from Spain, and discover America 1494…the Pope divides the New World with the Treaty of Tordesillas 1497-1505…John Cabot discovers the North American continent 1502-1533…Atahualpa, Pizarro and the Age of Discovery 1502…the Cantino planisphere 1513…Juan Ponce de Leon arrives in “La Florida” 1521-1587…Spain explores the So. Carolina, Florida coasts 1552…Bartolomé de las Casas exposes genocide by Spaniards in the New World 1562…France establishes a colony on Port Royal Sound 1570…world map - “the first modern atlas" 1577…Spain settles Santa Elena Island, Carolinas 1585-1604…The Anglo-Spanish War 1587…Spain ceases colonization 1588…Spanish Armada defeated by British Navy

Well, the major events of the 1400s were:- End of "La guerre de Cent Ans"- Invention of book printing- Fall of Constantinople- Columbus (re-)discovers America- Switzerland becomes de-facto independent after winning its last war against the Habsburgs in 1415, and an important European power until 1515 (see below)---For the 1500s,- Surely protestantism in its Lutheran, Calvinist and Anglican forms- Fall of the Actec and Inka empires to Spain- Turk expansion is stopped at Malta, Lepanto and Vienna- First circumnavigation of the world (by a Portuguese with a Spanish flotilla) - Almost more importantly, the second circumnavigation by Francis Drake, showing to the world that the English were a high-tech power (The "China lands a probe on the dark side of the moon moment" of the 1500s).- Copernicus' publishes "De revolutionibus orbium coelestium" - Switzerland becomes a de-facto neutral power after losing the war in Italy in 1515.---
